channel.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
channel.description:
[url]https://www.wowhead.com/news=223446/warlords-of-draenor-what-we-know-so-far[/url]
I know, I know; World of Warcraft is quite mundane and boring and turning into the MMO version of Call of Duty. This expansion however does look fairly interesting, considering they're adding a lot of new stuff in.
The main thing (imo) they're adding are RTS elements. I'd rather have Warcraft 4 since I'm a real RTS lover, but this could turn out to be intriguing.

item.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Listing all the Lords of War episodes released so far. Even those who aren’t Warcraft fans should take their time to watch them, they are masterfully done.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LG3RVCEwCPg ep1
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FRnabRRi1ik ep2
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J7VT7NG7e38 ep3
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fRlokbOelfg ep4

The gameplay and content (rather lack thereof) of the expansion itself are very lackluster imo, but the lore is better than ever, even if it’s just an alternate version of past Warcraft lore.

Read full topic
item.source: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor

item.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Cataclysm was already about timetravel, getting Demon Soul from the past in order to use it against Deathwing. Even TBC and WOTLK had their share. Caverns of Time anyone? Nozdormu pretty much exists across past, present and future and in all possible realities/outcomes as well.

Also Broxigar traveled back in time to War of the Ancients to pwn Sargeras.
So pretty much nothing new.

Read full topic
item.source: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor

item.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
The last expansion was about anthro pandas. I don’t think time travel is an especially odd direction to go.

Besides, the expansion seems to be less about the actual time travel and more just about being set on Draenor.

Read full topic

item.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
It doesn’t change the timeline, the past Draenor is of alternate universe, not them coming back in time to their own past changing future events, erasing the present, no such thing.The history as known (Warcraft > Mists of Pandaria) is intact.

Just 2 universes have been connected together, one is the present Azeroth and the other 35 years back AU Draenor.

Read full topic
item.source: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor

item.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
item.dc:creator: DeleteThis
item.description:
Good point, but this is a direct change in the timeline. It always irritates me when writers muddle about with directly changing the timeline in a fixed setting instead of only exploring different possibilities of what could have been.

cinematic trailer looks cool though
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7nqy66fAOBM
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=72V2J31XAUA

item.source: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor

item.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Betas aren’t supposed to be fun, but to be tested for bugs and balance though.
And don’t worry, something tells me Warcraft 4 isn’t that far off. And Diablo 3 is quite good at the moment. The reason people complain isn’t that Blizzard games aren’t good, but because they want them even better. The thing is, there aren’t that many alternatives of similar quality, so maybe people should just learn to enjoy what they’ve got.

Read full topic

where the fuck is my warcraft 4 and good diablo 3

item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
I’m thinking of quitting WoW. They have ruined it for me once they removed true nights from the game in Cata, it lost its unique feel and atmosphere.
Seriously, I care little about class and itemization changes, but don’t touch the weather!!! T_T

item.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
The dragon in question is https://wowpedia.org/Kairoz not Nozdormu. Although I pretty much doubt he is going to be the end boss. A tiny bronze dragon would be quite anticlimactic. I was serious about Medivh in fact, would be a better match up. Or even Ner’zhul for that matter The only thing we know for sure is that it won’t be an orc (confirmed by Blizzard) Oops! That means no Ner’zhul T_T

Read full topic

and WoD’s is unknown and left for us to speculate about

As far as I can tell from the info given to us at BlizzCon, the main villain of this expansion will be the guy behind Garrosh and the guy behind Garrosh is Nozdormu (“a cartain Bronze dragon that can control time”).

item.source: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor

item.title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
It’s very easy to overlevel for a zone now. The expansion looks great, but it’s still missing its “selling point” so to speak, like the announced features and the story are fancy and all, but how about in addition to the “future past Draenor” (lol?) also them remaking the “current past Draenor” (seriously they HAVE to sort out the timeline already) and a Demon Hunter class?

Just like MoP, it’s currently missing its appeal because the previous expansions had this “big bad guy” from the very start, but the latest two don’t. Garrosh being a final raid boss came as a “surprise” and WoD’s is unknown and left for us to speculate about. I bet on “AU AU AU version of Medivh, which in fact is our version of Medivh and as such wasn’t our Medivh to begin with”

Read full topic
item.source: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
